title: Drawing, "Study of Standing Figure", ca. 1670–1700
medium: Red chalk and black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Brandegee stamp verso, in violet: Lugt 1860c
inscribed: verso in brown pen, lower center: Giordano; in graphite, lower center: [illeg.] 10; in brown pen, bottom center: [illeg.] Luco Giordano; in graphite, lower right: 1938.88.6548; in brown ink, lower right corner: Studio
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Male figure dressed in classical garb holding a rounded stone in his right hand.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study of Standing Figure", ca. 1670–1700.
ca. 1670–1700. Red chalk and black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6548.
